definition: ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
the more...(the more...)/to recover/to heal/better
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
the more...(the more...)/to recover/to heal/better
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements

sentences.english: The Shell-sign resistance movement grew strong and raucous.
sentences.chinese: 殼牌廣告牌抵制運動愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: School Choice phenomenon is increasing in intensity, and society in general has become the focus of attention.
sentences.chinese: 擇校現象愈演愈烈，已經成爲社會上普遍關注的焦點。

sentences.english: After this, this kind of influence had being extended all with Neo-Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 爾後，這種影響一直延續，並愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: An ongoing debate here in Britain has been hotting up recently.
sentences.chinese: 最近，一次持續不斷的爭論在英國愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: At present, the competition for bancassurance business between insurance corporations becomes more and more intense.
sentences.chinese: 當前，各保險公司對銀行保險業務的競爭愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: The illegal waste dumping has mushroomed in the last decade.
sentences.chinese: 非法傾倒垃圾是現象近十年來愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: Recently job-related corruption in accounting by means of fabrication is getting more serious.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，會計腐敗現象日趨嚴重，假賬之風愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: Because the counteroffensive is just beginning, and it's going to be fierce.
sentences.chinese: 因爲反攻纔剛剛開始，並將愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: This will boost already rampant tomb-raiding and smuggling in China.
sentences.chinese: 也使中國業已猖獗的盜墓和走私活動愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: Otherwise, he says, the European crisis seems doomed to keep unraveling.
sentences.chinese: 否則的話，他表示，歐洲危機勢必將愈演愈烈。

sentences.english: The crime of the network grows in intensity, and the danger to the society is serious day by day.
sentences.chinese: 網絡犯罪愈演愈烈，對社會的危害日益嚴重。

definition: to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
clamor raises the dust (idiom); a tremendous clamor/to raise a tremendous stink
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
constantly in turmoil/crisis after crisis
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
protracted (idiom)/long and drawn-out
bubbling and gurgling/hubbubing/abuzz
disturbance/crisis/disputes/restlessness/CL:場|场[chang2]
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
could happen at any moment/on the verge
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
more critical with every passing day
to denounce/to condemn
war of words
a common occurrence (idiom)
